#summary Published OntoUML models

= OntoUML Models =

OntoUML has been successfully applied to a variety of domains, contexts and applications. In this page, we present a partial publication list that present several models specified in OntoUML.

If you are starting to learn OntoUML, you can use these models to discover more about the stereotypes and meta-properties of the OntoUML language. 

If you curious about OntoUML applications, you can check out these links to learn how they were developed, by whom and for what purpose.

If your are modelling your own ontology, you can go through them and see what you can reuse.

*Normative Acts*<br>
<i>Brazilian normative acts composition</i><br>
[http://ceur-ws.org/Vol-1041/ontobras-2013_paper14.pdf Ontology Reference Model for Normative Acts]<br>
<i>Pedro Paulo Favato Barcelos, Renata S. S. Guizzardi and Anilton S. Garcia</i><br>

*MPOG Ontology Draft*<br>
<i>Brazilian federal organizational structures</i><br>
[http://vocab.e.gov.br/2011/09/org.pdf Esboço de Modelagem Conceitual para Estruturas Organizacionais Governamentais Brasileiras e o SIORG]<br>
<i>Ministry of Planning, Budget and Management</i><br>

*CSGH Refactored*<br>
<i>Ontological analysis of a conceptual model about the human genome using OntoUML</i><br>
[http://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007%2F978-3-642-41924-9_40 Applying the Principles of an Ontology-Based Approach to a Conceptual Schema of Human Genome]<br>
<i>Ana Maria Martínez Ferrandis, Oscar Pastor López and Giancarlo Guizzardi</i><br>

*Open proVenance Ontology (OVO)*<br>
<i>Provenance of scientific experiments</i><br>
[http://ceur-ws.org/Vol-938/ontobras-most2012_paper12.pdf A Foundational Ontology to Support Scientific Experiments]<br>
<i>Sergio Manuel Serra da Cruz, Maria Luiza Machado Campos and Marta Mattoso</i><br>

*O3: OntoUML Org Ontology)*<br>
<i>Active structure of Organization </i><br>
Representing Organizational Structures in an Enterprise Architecture Language<br>
<i>Diorbert Pereira and João Paulo Andrade Almeida</i><br>

*CMTO: Configuration Management Task Ontology*<br>
<i>Configuration management</i><br>
[http://www.nemo.inf.ufes.br/files/a_configuration_management_task_ontology_for_semantic_integration_2012.pdf A Configuration Management Task Ontology for Semantic Integration]<br>
<i>Rodrigo Calhau and Ricardo de Almeida Falbo</i><br>

*OntoBio*<br>
<i>Biodiversity</i><br>
[https://code.google.com/p/ontobio/ Website]<br>
<i>Andréa Corrêa Flôres Albuquerque</i><br>
